description: From Middle French redoubler. Surface etymology is re- +â€Ž double.

entries.meaning: (bridge) An optional bid made by the side currently holding the highest bid for the contract, after the opposing side has doubled.

verbs.description: redouble (third-person singular simple present redoubles, present participle redoubling, simple past and past participle redoubled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To double, especially to double again; to increase considerably; to multiply; to intensify.
examples: Having lost sight of our objectives, we redoubled our efforts.

entries.meaning: (bridge, backgammon) To double an opponent's doubling bid.
To double again what was reduced to a  single state.
